alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:26AM EST until December 20 at 6:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey, including the following counties, Bergen, Essex, Hudson and Passaic. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 924 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Although the heavy rain has ended across the warning area, multiple streams across Bergen and Passaic counties are still experiencing moderate to major flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paterson, Passaic, Wayne, Hackensack, Bergenfield, Paramus, West Milford, Ridgewood, Rutherford, Ramsey, Ringwood, Pompton Lakes, Ridgefield, Tappan, Fort Lee, Englewood, Hawthorne, Oradell, Bloomingdale and Norwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
